I - PREMISE:

    NEAT in it's present state is metaphorically the wheel. 
=
In it's fundamental form, it was useful for various tasks. But the 
greater=
 utility was realized upon modification into gears, pulleys 
and bearings, =
and then being reintroduced as embedded elements of a 
machine, whose utili=
ty was more than simply the sum of it's parts. 
In like fashion, NEAT is a =
node, where upon being reintroduced as an 
embedded node into NEAT, in whic=
h NEAT evolves the appropriate 
connections to adapt the embedded "knowledg=
e" contained in the node 
to the objective of the current task, the fundame=
ntal building block 
of extensibility and reusability is achieved via recur=
sion and 
expansion of the definition of node.
    When we individually loo=
k into the dark abyss of our soul, the 
somber realization presents itself,=
 that we have become death. Given 
man's penchant for doing because he coul=
d, rather than taking pause 
to consider whether he should, the repercussio=
ns of practical 
extensibility and reusability of evolved networks will ecl=
ipse the 
splitting of the atom, opening the door to all manner of utility,=
 
whether for good or ill.


II - THE UNDERLYING EXPERIMENT: (see email ent=
itled: "Supervisor 
NEAT", dated: Oct. 18, 2006)

IV - THE SUPERVISOR:

# Inputs =3D (33) =
"pole2_markov.ne" + (33) params from prior exp 
population + (1) highest fi=
tness from prior exp population + (1) Bias
# Outputs =3D (33)
# Samples =3D=
 (4)
Parameters =3D Held Constant, same as "pole2_markov.ne", except as 
fo=
llows: pop_size =3D 100
Starting Genome: (33) connections from hardwired "p=
ole2_markov.ne" 
inputs to corresponding (33) outputs
Fitness: Summation of=
 Exp fitness for entire Exp population, over 
all specified Exp generations=
 per Supervisor generation, divided by 
# of Exp generations per Supervisor=
 generation

VI - CONCLUSIONS:

1) Recursive embedding of trained genome or population =
requires 
expanding definition of node.
2) Recursive embedding of evolving =
population needs automation of 
params via embedded supervisor on a sub-pop=
ulation basis.
3) Substantial acceleration of Exp fitness increase can be r=
ealized 
via pre-evolved or co-evolved params, even at the infant 
evolutio=
nary stage.
4) Increases in Exp fitness simultaneously occurred as Supervis=
or 
fitness increased, despite Supervisor fitness being based upon the 
ent=
ire Exp population to promote generality.
